Package me.hapyl.spigotutils.module.inventory

Class ItemBuilder

java.lang.Object
me.hapyl.spigotutils.module.inventory.ItemBuilder
public class ItemBuilder extends Object
Build ItemStack easier. Add names, lore, smart lore, enchants and even click events!

    • clone

      @Nullable public ItemBuilder clone()
      Creates a copy of this builder. Note that cloning builders with ID are not supported!
      Returns:
      a copy of this builder.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if builder has ID.

    • setSmartLore

      public ItemBuilder setSmartLore(@Nonnull String lore)
      Sets smart lore. This will remove the existing lore.

      Smart lore wraps automatically at the best places within the chat limit.

      Parameters:
      lore - - Lore to set.

    • setSmartLore

      public ItemBuilder setSmartLore(@Nonnull String lore, int limit)
      Sets smart lore with custom character limit.

      Smart lore wraps automatically at the best places within the chat limit.

      Parameters:
      lore - - Lore to set.
      limit - - Char limit.

      lore - - Lore to add.
      prefix - - Prefix to set.
      wrapAfter - - Wrap after this number of chars.

    • setLore

      public ItemBuilder setLore(int line, @Nonnull String lore)
      Sets the lore at the given line.
      Parameters:
      line - - Index of line.
      lore - - Lore to set.

    • addLore

      public ItemBuilder addLore(@Nonnull String lore, @Nonnull org.bukkit.ChatColor prefixColor)
      Sets the item lore. You can use NEW_LINE_SEPARATOR to insert a new line, or use addTextBlockLore(String, Object...).
      Parameters:
      lore - - Lore to set.
      prefixColor - - Color of the text after split.

      Sets the item lore. You can use NEW_LINE_SEPARATOR to insert a new line, or use addTextBlockLore(String, Object...).

      lore - - Lore to set.

      public ItemBuilder addLore()
      Adds an empty lore line.

    • setLore

      public ItemBuilder setLore(@Nonnull String lore, @Nonnull String separator)
      Sets the item lore with custom new line separator. The default line separator is NEW_LINE_SEPARATOR.
      Parameters:
      lore - - Lore to set.
      separator - - Separator to split the lines.

    • addTextBlockLore

      public ItemBuilder addTextBlockLore(@Nonnull String textBlock, @Nullable Object... format)
      Adds text block as smart lore to the item. Each line will be treated as a paragraph.

      NEW_LINE_SEPARATOR can be used as a custom separator.

      Prefix can be added by using ;; before the actual string, ex: 

           &c;;Hello World__Goodbye World
      will be formatted as: 
           &cHello World
     &cGoodbye World
      Parameters:
      textBlock - - Text block.

    • addTextBlockLore

      public ItemBuilder addTextBlockLore(@Nonnull String textBlock, int charLimit, @Nullable Object... format)
      Adds text block as smart lore to the item. Each line will be treated as a paragraph.

      NEW_LINE_SEPARATOR can be used as a custom separator.

      Prefix can be added by using ;; before the actual string, ex: 

           &c;;Hello World__Goodbye World
      will be formatted as: 
           &cHello World
     &cGoodbye World
      Parameters:
      textBlock - - Text block.
      charLimit - - Char wrap limit.

    • addTextBlockLore

      public ItemBuilder addTextBlockLore(@Nonnull String textBlock, @Nonnull String linePrefix, int charLimit, @Nullable Object... format)

      If copying from Minecraft-Heads, use Other -> Minecraft-URL value, which should look something like this: 87fbe93a9c518883186a2aefbd2b7df18ba05a8a7dd1a756ef6565d3e5807a0c
